item.title: Graffiti on a residential building, 18th November
item.description:
Graffiti on NLMCC House on Morning Lane (junction with Retreat Place) This was originally reported on the 10 July 2025 and this was not resolved. As you can see from the pictures attached this has attracted more graffiti tagging. Please deal with this ASAP

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Retreat Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Lights not working, 18th November
item.description:
2 lights on Beckenham Green are not working. Circled in photo. 1 light located near entrance from St Georges Road . 1 light in entrance from Alberamarle Road. (Opp Co-op)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Georges Road, Beckenham, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Massive pile of dumped rubbish,, 18th November
item.description:
The rubbish has been piled up over the course of three weeks now, it’s disgusting. It’s gonna start attracting rats and other animals go property’s. Personal experience is that foxes have been bringing rubbish into my garden such as chicken wrappers because people dumping stuff like this. The rubbish is pilled up so bad that it’s now even falling into road and rubbish being on the loose on the street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brookhill Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Once again bins overflowing, 18th November
item.description:
This is a repeat problem. The bins on Highbridge Wharf MUST be emptied more frequently. This again has been overflowing for days. It makes an eyesore of the front of Trinity Hospital. Please can you try and deal with the systemic issue here and empty frequently.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Highbridge Wharf, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Queens Drive, 18th November
item.description:
Queens Drive disgusting !! most of the rubbish that was left at the bin site, has now blown on the green outside Bramfield court Queens drive side, largely due to the bins not being emptied frequently enough.. the rest of the street needs sweeping too
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lee Conservancy Road leaves need clearing, 18th November
item.description:
The leaves that fall from Mabley Green fill our front AND back gardens and the road too. They obscure road markings, potholes and are a hazard. You should clear all leaves, including in private gardens because the trees belong to the council.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lee Conservancy Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous leaning tree in east Greenwich pleasaunce, 18th November
item.description:
Tree leaning on brick wall bordering residential property, numbers 27/28 Chevening Road. Needs assessing asap before it causes damage to wall and private property.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chevening Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken sunken paving slabs., 18th November
item.description:
Pavement outside 55 Therapia Road. Broken paving slabs have subsided, creating a trip hazard with adjacent slabs on one side and tarmac on the other. I fell there on Saturday and have only now been able to check on what caused me to fall

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Therapia Road, Nunhead, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet
